Rulings.Edison:
●During the turn that Spirit Elimination is activated; all monsters removed from play must be from your side of the field. This means that you can't activated Soul Release and remove two monsters from your side of the field and three from your GY.
●Any conditions set on the Monster Cards that would be removed from the GY must still be fulfilled on the Monsters removed from your side of the field. For example, to Special Summon Dark Necrofear you must remove 3 Fiend-Type Monsters from your side of the field.
●You can activate Spirit Elimination while Necrovalley is active.
Rulings.Tengu:
●During the turn that Spirit Elimination is activated; all monsters removed from play must be from your side of the field. This means that you cannot activated Soul Release and remove two monsters from your side of the field and three from your GY.
●Any conditions set on the Monster Cards that would be removed from the GY must still be fulfilled on the Monsters removed from your side of the field. For example, to Special Summon Dark Necrofear you must remove 3 Fiend-Type Monsters from your side of the field.
●You can activate Spirit Elimination while Necrovalley is active.
Rulings.Goat:
●During the turn that Spirit Elimination is activated; all monsters removed from play must be from your side of the field. This means that you cannot activated Soul Release and remove two monsters from your side of the field and three from your GY.
●Any conditions set on the Monster Cards that would be removed from the GY must still be fulfilled on the Monsters removed from your side of the field. For example, to Special Summon Dark Necrofear you must remove 3 Fiends from your side of the field.
●You can activate Spirit Elimination while Necrovalley is applying. 
●Q: Can you remove any monsters from play for monsters like “Dark Necrofear”? 
A: If the condition requires specific types of cards, those same type of cards must be removed from the field. Example: Dark Necrofear requires Fiend. It must be Fiend that you remove from the field in substitution of a Fiend in the GY.

Rulings.Base: 1. During the turn that "Spirit Elimination" is activated; all monsters removed from play must be from your side of the field. This means that you cannot activated "Soul Release" and remove two monsters from your side of the field and three from your GY.\n2. Any conditions set on the Monster Cards that would be removed from the GY must still be fulfilled on the Monsters removed from your side of the field. For example, to Special Summon "Dark Necrofear" you must remove 3 Fiend-Type Monsters from your side of the field.\n3. You can activate "Spirit Elimination" while "Necrovalley" is active.

PSCT.Base: When monsters in the Graveyard are removed from play, remove monsters on your side of the field from play as substitutes. This card remains active until the end of the turn that it is activated. The substitutes remain removed from play.
